meanings.definition: To write or create (something) again in a different or improved form.
meanings.sent1: She redrafted her essay to make it better.
meanings.sent2: The author redrafted the story to fix the plot holes.
meanings.sent3: He redrafted his drawing, but it still looked like a scribble.
meanings.sent4: The team redrafted their game plan for success.
meanings.sent5: After feedback, she redrafted her speech to be more engaging.

meanings.definition: To revise or edit (a document or text) for publication or presentation.
meanings.sent1: The editor redrafted the article for clarity.
meanings.sent2: They redrafted the contract to include new terms.
meanings.sent3: He redrafted the letter, adding a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: She redrafted the presentation to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent5: The student redrafted the essay to meet the word count requirement.
